thread.title: Drew Brees: 'It hasn't come together yet, but it will'
thread.title_full: Drew Brees: 'It hasn't come together yet, but it will' | NOLA.com

author: Evan Woodbery, NOLA.com | The Times-Picayune
title: Drew Brees: 'It hasn't come together yet, but it will'
text:
PHILADELPHIA -- The New Orleans Saints are 1-4 and their season is foundering after a 39-17 loss to the Philadelphia Eagles on Sunday at Lincoln Financial Field.
But quarterback Drew Brees said the struggles haven't caused him to question the desire of his teammates.
"We have great guys," he said. "I think we're doing things the right way. I think guys are working their tails off."
Brees completed 26-of-43 passes for 335 yards and two touchdowns on Sunday, but he also lost two fumbles on sacks and threw an interception. (New Saints tight end Michael Hoomanawanui had the fourth turnover when he was hit just after catching a pass and fumbled the ball).
"We better score 50 points if we're going to turn the ball over four times," Brees said.
Instead, the Saints managed only 17, and the last touchdown as time expired padded statistics but was otherwise meaningless.
But Brees said the poor play wasn't a reflection of the locker room.
"I don't want to hear anything about youth. I don't want to hear anything about talent. I don't want to hear anything about anything other than what we have to do to win the game," he said.
The Saints (1-4) get only a short break before playing the Atlanta Falcons (5-0) at the Mercedes-Benz Superdome on Thursday night.
"I love what we're capable of," Brees said. "I think guys are doing a great job, guys are doing the right thing, guys are taking care of their bodies...We have great guys. We have great leaders and guys who want to do the right thing, who want to be great. So it's frustrating when you're sitting here at 1-4."
Brees' optimism hasn't dimmed.
"We feel like we have the right pieces in place," he said. "It hasn't come together yet, but it will."
Drew Brees, 'This game should have been much closer. We turned the ball over four times' Drew Brees, 'This game should have been much closer. We turned the ball over four times'
